CatDescriptText: Mr. Bennie Johnson, construction worker, and father, of 2025 Rose St., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "There is too much tax now, but I think that because this would be for an exceptionally good cause, the taxpayers should not oppose it. The reason is that a school is something we have to have, because we want our children and must have them educated.  Therefore, most taxpayers, I believe, would approve the raise because school should rate just as high as the best of homes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bennie Johnson, wearing moustache, patterned button down coat with collar and lapels, and cap, carrying paper bag, standing in front of corner of stone building with tree, street, and pedestrians on right in background
